intro: Ajania nematoloba, commonly known as the narrowleaf ajania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
